page.title: 18MR. PALMER (continued)
page.content: Willcox, of the late Miss Willcox's father and Mr. P. Palmer. Mr. Palmer has been involved with five people who had fallen in the River Severn. One story was the day Mr. Palmer was underway between Chepstow and Frampton, having picked up remains of a fallen plane when he found the body of an American airman in the water. Once a tramp fell in the water at Newport and was washed up at Shepperdine. There was once 3 men and a child, their boat sank in the Severn. Some men in three speed boats went out to rescue them, but were worried about the tide, so went back to shore. Mr. Palmer saw them, he got his boat and sailed out to them, he got the child in the boat and tied the three men onto it, but his boat did not have the power to take the weight, so he called to the men in the speed
